image.altText: Shane walks along carrying documents and wearing sunglasses.

items.synopsis: The board of inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann over the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins was sparked by allegations made by ACT Director of Public Prosecutions Shane Drumgold against police. But its final report has found those allegations were "incorrect" and "without any rational basis".

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann inquiry report heavily criticises man who prosecuted the case of 'knowingly lying' to Chief Justice

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair and glasses speaking a lecturn in front of an australian flag

items.synopsis: The Liberal senator launches legal action in the WA Supreme Court against Brittany Higgins, alleging two social media posts defamed her.

title.children: Senator Linda Reynolds sues Brittany Higgins for defamation over social media posts

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a black hoodie

items.synopsis: Brett Andrew Button will face a total of 63 offences next week, after a bus crash in June in which 10 people died.

title.children: Hunter Valley bus crash driver to face 43 additional charges

image.altText: four images of four different men superimposed over an image of a still ocean

items.synopsis: Australian Defence Force Chief of Joint Operations Lieutenant General Greg Bilton says underwater searches for the MRH90 Taipan has found further debris including parts of the cockpit and human remains.

title.children: Human remains found near Taipan helicopter wreckage

image.altText: Cruise ship passengers disembark from the Princess Cruises owned Ruby Princess at Circular Quay in Sydney.

items.synopsis: A number of passengers of the COVID-affected Ruby Princess had signed a contract waiving rights to join class actions. The customers say that contract breached Australian consumer law.

title.children: Some Ruby Princess passengers signed a contract waiving rights to class actions. They're taking the fight to the High Court

items.synopsis: In 1994, a looter codenamed The Falcon dug up an ancient treasure that decades later would end up in an Australian gallery. Now, it's being given back.

title.children: He dug up an ancient treasure. He had no idea the eye-watering price it would later fetch

image.altText: BBC's Chris Hughes interviews Maitlan Brown

items.synopsis: The BBC says comments made on air about female Australian all-rounder Maitlan Brown were "not appropriate".

title.children: BBC presenter Chris Hughes warned after 'Barbie' comment to Aussie cricketer Maitlan Brown

image.altText: John Daun pictured in an aged care facility.

items.synopsis: Melissa Daun says for the two years her father lived at Southern Cross Care's aged care home in South Hobart it felt like "banging your head against a wall".

title.children: Melissa got a sympathy card from her father's aged care home after he died. She sent it back

image.altText: A man in a navy blue suit.

items.synopsis: Today's latest news, as it happens.

title.children: ACT government says it won't investigate leaking of Bruce Lehrmann report — The latest news with The Loop

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Thanks for joining us. If you're catching up, here were some of the top stories we covered (hit the link to jump straight to the post): Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and his wife announce separation No shooter, no injuries reported at US capitol after 'bad call' Lizzo's former dancer discusses lawsuit against singer US police are 'prepared for whatever might happen' ahead of Donald Trump's court appearance Assistant treasurer says anti-scams legislation is likely 'early next year' AFDP seizes $4.2m and a Perth house over alleged daycare fraud ACT govenrment says it won't investigate leaking of Lehermann report Hunter Valley wedding bus crash driver faces 43 additional charges Human remains and cockpit debris found in search for downed MRH-90 helicopter You can keep up-to-date on the ABC News website and by subscribing to our mobile news alerts .
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: That's all for The Loop today

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The board of inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann over the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins was sparked by allegations made by ACT Director of Public Prosecutions Shane Drumgold against police. But its final report has found those allegations were "incorrect" and "without any rational basis". You can read more about this story here:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Bruce Lehrmann inquiry report heavily criticises man who prosecuted the case of 'knowingly lying' to chief justice

featuredLink.title: Bruce Lehrmann inquiry report heavily criticises man who prosecuted the case of 'knowingly lying' to Chief Justice

children.content: The board of inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann over the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins was sparked by allegations made by ACT
Director of Public Prosecutions Shane Drumgold against police.
But its final report has found those allegations were "incorrect" and "without any rational basis".
You can read more about this story here:

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Former defence minister Linda Reynolds is suing ex-Canberra political staffer Brittany Higgins over two social media posts. In a writ filed in the WA Supreme Court, the senator alleges Higgins defamed her in the posts, one on Instagram and one on Twitter. She is also claiming Higgins breached a settlement contract entered in 2021 which contained a non-disparagement clause. More on this story here:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Senator Linda Reynolds launches defamation case against Brittany Higgins

featuredLink.title: Senator Linda Reynolds sues Brittany Higgins for defamation over social media posts

children.content: Former defence minister Linda Reynolds is suing ex-Canberra political staffer Brittany Higgins over two social media posts.
In a writ filed in the WA Supreme Court, the senator alleges Higgins defamed her in the posts, one on Instagram and one on Twitter.
She is also claiming Higgins breached a settlement contract entered in 2021 which contained a non-disparagement clause.

image.altText: A headshot of Belinda

items.synopsis: Professional garbologist Bel has so little landfill waste she's ditched her red bin. Here's how she did it.

title.children: Bel has so little household waste she's ditched her red bin. She shares some simple tips

image.altText: A red car is just showing out of soil and trees which have slipped off a hill on a beach

items.synopsis: A major landslip has buried a car and damaged another at a popular tourist destination. Residents say it is the biggest slip they have seen in the region.

title.children: Drivers 'very lucky' not to be hurt in Rainbow Beach landslip

image.altText: A large piece of machinery being pulled from the water.

items.synopsis: Inside the army community there is growing anger over Friday's tragedy and speculation the troubled MRH-90 fleet may never return to full operations.

title.children: 'Furious': Anger inside army at fatal Taipan helicopter crash

image.altText: Inside a cinder block cell with a chair, a light, unplastered wall, a fan and concreate ground. Very confined

items.synopsis: The FBI is looking for more potential victims after a woman kidnapped and locked in a makeshift cell by a man posing as an undercover police officer managed to escape.

title.children: US woman escapes after being kidnapped, locked up in homemade cell

image.altText: An image of Sydney's CBD, with people walking, faces not visible, carrying shopping bags.

items.synopsis: A sharp dip in retail sales volumes offered a big hint as to why there was no interest rate hike from the RBA this week, as the ASX took a dive after that bad news out of the US yesterday about its credit rating. Catch up on the market activity from today.

title.children: Slowdown in consumption 'across the board' as higher rates and inflation bite, explaining RBA pause, as dollar dips — as it happened

image.altText: People wearing matching shirts hold signs and yell

items.synopsis: The NSW teachers union is encouraging teachers to walk out of classrooms during visits by the premier, deputy premier, education minister or treasurer, as negotiations break down.

title.children: 'A kick in the guts for every teacher in NSW': Union furious after pay deal abandoned by state government

image.altText: Angela Fitzwater sits in a chair in a home, dressed warmly as she looks forward with a serious expression.

items.synopsis: After falling victim to scams, the 83-year-old spent three months chasing an answer from her bank's fraud department.

title.children: Angela recognised the 'hi mum' scam too late — but feels her bank let her down with what came next

image.altText: Somalia's Nasra Abukar crosses the line last in the women's 100 metres at the FISU World University Games in Chengdu, China.

items.synopsis: Somalia's university union says it has not sent any runners to the World University Games in China, but Nasra Abukar still appeared in the 100m heats, running an embarrassingly slow race.

title.children: Somalian's glacial 100m race prompts apology from country's sports minister

image.altText: Queensland Nurses and Midwives' Union (QMNU) secretary Kate Veach with pamphlet that says 'Send help' at press conference

items.synopsis: Queensland nurses union is campaigning to introduce minimum nurse-to-patient ratios in public hospital maternity units with midwives under pressure.

title.children: Under pressure midwives expected to care for up to 20 'human heartbeats' at a time

image.altText: Three women sit on a reformer pilates bed holding their babies

items.synopsis: The pelvic floor is something most people don't talk about and many don't even know about. Here's why it's important and how to look after yours.

title.children: We rarely talk about pelvic floors. Here's why it's important and how to look after yours

image.altText: A young white woman carefully lifting a toddler up at a playground

items.synopsis: New research suggests the number of Australian women who sustain life-altering injuries to their pelvic floor after birth is far higher than acknowledged.

title.children: Samantha paid thousands to recover from her birth injury. She says it shouldn't have to be that way

image.altText: Hawthorn Hawks signage at the clubs headquarters in Melbourne.

items.synopsis: The author of the Hawthorn Football Club cultural safety review and former CEO of the Murray Valley Aboriginal Cooperative has been charged as part of a Victoria Police investigation into alleged financial mismanagement.

title.children: Hawthorn Football Club cultural safety review author Phil Egan charged with fraud-related offences

image.altText: A police car, two ambulances and a fire truck at night

items.synopsis: The death of a driver in Adelaide's north early this morning takes the number of lives lost on SA's roads so far this year above what it was for the whole of 2022.

title.children: Fatal crash takes SA road deaths above total for whole of last year

image.altText: Investigators examine a damaged skyscraper in Moscow.

items.synopsis: The IQ Complex in Moscow's west has been the target of successive drone strikes in what Russia has called an attempted "terrorist attack".

title.children: Why has this skyscraper in Moscow been hit by two drone strikes in three days?

image.altText: A vendor sits near a board depicting surveillance cameras during Security China 2023 in Beijing.

items.synopsis: The US State Department expresses "great concern" after China's Ministry of State Security calls on the public to help implement a new counterespionage law.

title.children: US expresses 'great concern' over China's call to mobilise entire nation in counterespionage

image.altText: Teams app next to keyboard

items.synopsis: Russian hackers posing as tech support staff in Microsoft Teams chats have stolen log-in credentials from dozens of global organisations.

title.children: Russian hackers posing as tech support behind cyber attack on Microsoft Teams

image.altText: A group of people stand in the water as workers assemble large orange buoys with wire.

items.synopsis: The Mexican foreign minister has raised fresh safety concerns after the discovery of the body found stuck in the barrier of buoys in the Rio Grande.

title.children: Body found stuck in Texas-Mexico border buoy barrier ignites fresh safety concerns

image.altText: Two skinny new born babies with drips attached to them.

items.synopsis: In one of Haiti's poorest and most dangerous neighbourhoods, a hospital is working to help malnourished newborns.

title.children: Amid gang violence, hunger and scarce aid, a hospital in Haiti is helping malnourished newborns

image.altText: Sydney skyline at night.

items.synopsis: Australia's biggest companies are detailing the impact cost-of-living pressures and high interest rates have had on their bottom line. Analysts say the results will give an early warning sign as to where the economy is heading.

title.children: 'Consumer spending has really fallen off a cliff': Corporate reporting season offers a window on the economy's future

image.altText: An Uber driver navigating using a mobile phone

items.synopsis: A record number of Australians are working multiple jobs, as employees try to keep up with a near 10 per cent surge in the cost of living.

title.children: Shaheryar has a professional job, but he's driving rideshare to make his mortgage — and he's not alone

image.altText: A man holds a phone to his ear, slightly obscured by gum leaves.

items.synopsis: The federal government's $40 million Mobile Black Spot Program will be audited by the Commonwealth's spending watchdog, after allegations it was used for pork-barrelling in Labor seats.

title.children: Mobile blackspot grants to be audited over pork-barrelling claims

image.altText: Panama's Marta Cox slides on her knees to celebrate a goal at the FIFA Women's World Cup.

items.synopsis: Panama captain Marta Cox scores a stunning free kick against France, the World Cup career of a legend ends, and South Africa takes down football giants. Here are five quick hits from Wednesday's matches.

title.children: World Cup five quick hits — Brazil great Marta bows out as another Marta scores possible goal of the tournament
